step1.para: Begin the disassembly by setting the transmission on a bench. Remove the shift tower and air lines ( Figure 12).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Remove Shift Tower and Air Lines

step1.para: To remove an air line from an instant fitting, push the bushing down with a small screwdriver or your fingernail and pull the tubing ( Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 14. Remove Air Line

step1.para: Remove the interlock plate, retainer and gasket. Also remove the three springs and poppet balls ( Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Remove Interlock Plate, Retainer and Gasket

step1.para: Next remove the air control valve and gasket, the air lines, and the three air control valve pins ( Figure 15).

figure.caption: Figure 16. Remove Air Control Valve and Gasket, Air Lines, and Air Control Valve Pins

step1.para: Remove the back-up light switch and pin ( Figure 16).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Remove Back-Up Light Switch and Pin

step1.para: Remove the two clutch housing bolts from the case. Also remove all but four clutch housing- to-case bolts ( Figure 17).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Remove Clutch Housing Bolts

step1.para: Attach a bracket or lift hooks to the range section of the transmission ( Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Attach Bracket or Lift Hooks to Range Section of Transmission

step1.para: Stand the transmission on end on a workbench that contains a hole for the drive gear ( Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 20. Stand Transmission on End on Workbench

step1.para: Continue by removing the end yoke or flange, and the speedometer gear ( Figure 20).

figure.caption: Figure 21. Remove End Yoke or Flange and Speedometer Gear

step1.para: The range piston is removed next. Also remove the O-ring on the fork rod and the O-ring under the piston ( Figure 21.

figure.caption: Figure 22. Remove Range Piston

step1.para: Remove the countershaft bearing retainer caps and the air regulator valve ( Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Remove Countershaft Bearing Retainer Caps and Air Regulator Valve

step1.para: Remove the output bearing cap and shims ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Remove Output Bearing Cap and Shims

step1.para: Remove the range case bolts. Using pry bars in the milled slots will make case removal easier ( Figure 24).

figure.caption: Figure 25. Remove Range Case Bolts

step1.para: Lift the range section from the unit ( Figure 25).

figure.caption: Figure 26. Lift Range Section From Unit

step1.para: Spread the countershafts and lift the mainshaft low range gear from the case ( Figure 26).

figure.caption: Figure 27. Lift Mainshaft Low Range Gear From Case

step1.para: Remove the range synchronizer and fork assembly ( Figure 27).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Remove Range Synchronizer and Fork Assembly

step1.para: Separate the synchronizer ( Figure 28). Replacement parts may be purchased separately.

warning.para: Use care when separating the synchronizer as the sudden release of the springs may cause personal injury.

figure.caption: Figure 29. Separate Synchronizer

step1.para: The synchronizer cup and the clutch drive gear are removed next ( Figure 29).

figure.caption: Figure 30. Remove Synchronizer Cup and Clutch Drive Gear

step1.para: Lift high range gear from the case ( Figure 30).

figure.caption: Figure 31. Lift High Range Gear From Case

step1.para: Simultaneously lift the countershafts straight up to remove them ( Figure 31).

figure.caption: Figure 32. Lift Countershafts Straight Up

step1.para: Now remove the mainshaft reverse gear and rear thrust plate together ( Figure 32).

figure.caption: Figure 33. Remove Mainshaft Reverse Gear and Rear Thrust Plate

step1.para: Remove the countershaft reverse gears ( Figure 33).

figure.caption: Figure 34. Remove Countershaft Reverse Gears

step1.para: Next remove the countershaft rear bearing retainer plates and shims ( Figure 34). This completes disassembly of the rear box as it would be performed during a complete unit teardown.

figure.caption: Figure 35. Remove Countershaft Rear Bearing Retainer Plates and Shims
